titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012. Modified by Dot Porter in 2017.

bioghist.p: William L. Dix was curator of the lichen herbarium at the Academy of Natural Sciences.

scopecontent.p: The collection includes: incoming and a small amount of outgoing correspondence regarding exchange of specimens, editing and publication of articles; catalogues of lichens in collections, including an inventory of Lichenes exsiccati in North American Herbaria, 1957; biographical information about the Rev. A.B. Langlois, a missionary and botanical researcher (some of whose specimens are housed at the Academy); and annotated typescripts of articles, including a draft of "Langlois' Louisiana Cladoniae." Many of Dix's correspondents were prominent lichenologists and include Howard A. Crum of the American Bryological Society, William Culberson of the Farlow Herbarium of Harvard University, and Albert Herre of the University of Washington.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
